content.description: A reachy start to a good left-hand will help you gain the juggy rail. Traverse right along the rail with good feet until it runs out. Find the two good crimps and pull up to high feet to assist with the mantle.
content.protection: A pad or two to protect the full length of the traverse.
content.location:
On the due-west side of the boulder, left of

Current Corner

content.description:
Sit start on a couple of pinchy holds down low to big jugs and an easy topout. I started with my right heel on the big jug to the right and found this to be the most enjoyable variant. Other variants are definitely possible since this section of the rock has the biggest and best holds.

This one had lots of chalk on it when I got there so I am sure that its been done before.
content.protection: Optional pad as the crux is the sit start
content.location: Located on the backside (southside) of the smaller boulder.

content.description: Sit start on good slopers and poor footholds, move to obvious block and continue left to finish on Spark Plug. Steep moves on big holds, crux is getting setup to finish on Spark Plug.
content.location: South side of the east boulder

content.description:
Start low in the corner and make a balancy move out to a good right-hand crimp on the face. To top out, find the good cracks in the top of the left and right sides of the corners.

You could reach the good crimps in the face from the ground to make this easier, but the moves to reach them from low on the corner are enjoyable.
content.location: The corner on the back (southwest) side of the larger boulder

content.description:
Start on two well chalked jugs and go up to the obvious diagonal rail. Follow the rail for a couple moves and top out to the left.

Alternative route is to follow the line of the rail to an eventual top out to the right. Probably closer to V2.
content.protection: Crashpad. Two for the alternative top out.
content.location: 10ft to the left of Spark Plug.
